div1.p: Blackwood sends a contribution for Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from N.J. Blackwood to Howard A. Kelly, July 5, 1907
div1.opener:
Ans
UNITED STATES SHIP NEW JERSEY
c/o Postmaster, N. Y-
July 5, 1907-
Mr. Howard A. Kelly-
Dear Sir:-
div1.p:
I have just seen in the
Outlook for June 29th, the account
of the needs of John R. Kissinger,
whose sublime heroism in the
cause of Medical Research, and
the general welfare of the human
race appeals to my deepest feel-
ings- I think his care ought
to be taken up by the Medical
profession generally, those in the
Medical Corps of the Army & Navy
particularly, and by every one who
admires true heroism & unselfish
devotion to the worlds best aims-

I enclose my check for $5.00
as a little mite towards helping
this deserving cause, and wish
it could be more- Hoping there
may be a more generous response
to this worthy charity, believe me
